fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Upgrading with Windows installer fails due to logon user change for Windows service

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Install Confluence 7.1.0 or earlier with Windows installer
 # Observe that the logon user for Windows service is *Local System*
 !local_system.png|thumbnail! 
 # Upgrade to Confluence 7.1.1 or later with Windows installer

h3. Expected Results
Upgrade should complete without any issues.

h3. Actual Results
Upgrade does not run and logon user for Windows service is now *Network Service*. Upgrade fails due to user change. 
 !network_service.png|thumbnail! 

{{service.bat}} has hard coded in NetworkService account for user.

{code:title=service.bat}
"%EXECUTABLE%" //IS//%SERVICE_NAME% --ServiceUser "NT AUTHORITY\NetworkService" ^
{code}

The change to *Network Service* was made to fix the vulnerability documented below:
* [CONFSERVER-58808|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-58808]: DLL hijacking in Confluence Server Windows installations

h3. Solution

For fresh installation or upgrades, the *NT AUTHORITY\NetworkService* will be granted the full permission for following folders:
* Installation folder: C:\Program Files\Atlassian\Confluence
* Application data folder: C:\Program Files\Atlassian\Application Data\Confluence

Make sure the *NT AUTHORITY\NetworkService* account is configured on your Windows Server.
fields.summary: Upgrading with Windows installer fails due to logon user change for Windows service

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Rebuilding the search index in the UI in Confluence Data Center as explained [in this KB article|https://confluence.atlassian.com/doc/content-index-administration-148844.html] will run the reindex *only* on the node in which the task was triggered.
 However, [restoring a Space|https://confluence.atlassian.com/doc/restoring-a-space-152036.html] with "Build Index" checked will trigger a full site reindex on *all* nodes, which can cause heavy load to the database and filesystem.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Go to Confluence Administration > General Configuration > Backup and Restore.
 # Under Upload a site or space export file, click Choose File and browse for your space export file.
 # Check _Build Index_ box.
 # Choose Upload and import.

h3. Expected Results
 * The site reindex is expected to be executed only on the node that triggered the space import and not on all nodes simultaneously.
 * *If* a full site reindex should run on all nodes, then it should be done in a serial and unparalleled way (one node at a time).

h3. Actual Results
 * A full site reindex is triggered on all nodes concurrently.

h3. Workaround

Uncheck "Build Index" and [Rebuild The Content Indexes|https://confluence.atlassian.com/confkb/how-to-rebuild-the-content-indexes-from-scratch-on-confluence-data-center-833941594.html] manually after space import.
fields.summary: Importing a space on Confluence Data Center triggers a full site reindex on all nodes in the cluster

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Team Calendar stylesheets conflicts with stylesheets of some apps like [MultiExcerpt|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/apps/169/multiexcerpt?hosting=server&tab=overview]


h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Confluence v7.0.2
# Install [MultiExcerpt|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/apps/169/multiexcerpt?hosting=server&tab=overview] app
# Install Team Calendar (TC) v6.0.47
# Create a page with 8 *MultiExcerpts*
# Create a new page and add *MultiExcerpt Include* macro
# From the drop-down menu, not all of the 8 excerpts are visible
 !cal_enabled.png|thumbnail! 
# Disabling the Team Calendar resolved the issue and all 8 excerpts were visible
 !cal_disabled.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Expected Results

From the drop-down menu, all of the 8 excerpts should visible. 
8 is just the threshold number, any excerpts greater than 8 will not be visible. 


h3. Actual Results

The drop-down menu should populate the full list of excerpts.

h3. Notes

Analyses of the web-requests with both TC enabled and disabled shows that full data set is always returned from Confluence, though it is not rendered properly if TC is enabled.

The following stylesheet of TC needs to be better scoped, so it change's only it's own behaviour and doesn't conflict with other apps.
{code:css}
.aui-select2-drop.aui-dropdown2.aui-style-default {
    max-height: 200px;
    overflow-y: hidden;
}
{code}

h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Team Calendar stylesheet needs to be better scoped

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Starting in February 2020, Chrome version 80 (and later Firefox and IE as well) will start enforcing different requirements on cross-site cookies. Reference [https://blog.chromium.org/2019/10/developers-get-ready-for-new.html] for full details on the change in Chrome's behavior.

Warnings about this can be seen in the Developer Tools console when navigating to pages that have content from an app-linked Jira instance. 
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # (prior to the Chrome version 80 rollout) In Chrome version 77+ go to "chrome://flags/"
 # Search for "SameSite" and enable "SameSite by default cookies" and "Cookies without SameSite must be secure"
 # In a Confluence instance which has an application link to a Jira instance, navigate to a Confluence page that has integrated content from Jira (gadgets, issue filters, etc.) 

h3. Expected Results

Jira content will be displayed and no warning messages about the cross-site cookies will be displayed in the Developer Tools console. 
h3. Actual Results

Jira content is displayed and the below message is displayed in the Developer Tools console:
{noformat}
A cookie associated with a cross-site resource at http://JIRA-HOSTNAME/ 
was set without the `SameSite` attribute. A future release of Chrome will 
only deliver cookies with cross-site requests if they are set 
with `SameSite=None` and `Secure`. You can review cookies in 
developer tools under Application>Storage>Cookies and see 
more details at https://www.chromestatus.com/feature/5088147346030592 
and https://www.chromestatus.com/feature/5633521622188032.
{noformat}
h3. Workaround
 * Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior within Confluence. 
 * Disable `SameSite` change at Chrome as described in [Turning off Google Chrome SameSite Cookie Enforcement|https://support.siteimprove.com/hc/en-gb/articles/360007364778-Turning-off-Google-Chrome-SameSite-Cookie-Enforcement].
 * Add cookie headers (SameSite=None) at Tomcat level, Tomcat 8.5.42 introduced a global same-site cookie setting in the default _Rfc6265CookieProcessor_.  Check [Tomcat and Jetty SameSite Workarounds|https://wiki.shibboleth.net/confluence/display/DEV/Tomcat+and+Jetty+SameSite+Workarounds] for more details
 * Add cookie headers at the proxy level:
 ** For example, if using HAProxy, set _SameSite=None_ and explicitly add _Secure_ as it's required (credit to [~ov3]):
{code:java}
http-response replace-header Set-Cookie ^(.*) \1;\ SameSite=None;\ Secure
{code}

 ** Likewise for F5, an iRule can be utilized:
{code:java}
# Set SameSite attribute for the JSESSIONID cookie to "lax"
when HTTP_RESPONSE {
    if {[HTTP::cookie exists "JSESSIONID"]}{
        HTTP::cookie attribute "JSESSIONID" remove {samesite}
        HTTP::cookie attribute "JSESSIONID" insert {samesite} "lax"
    }
}
{code}
fields.summary: When Chrome requires "SameSite=None; Secure" for cross-site cookies, warning messages are displayed in the Developer Tools console

fields.description:
When a page is edited and the "Notify watchers" option is checked in Confluence, the application will send to the page watchers a notification containing a small block of information about what was changed on that page.

However, if the page is complex, split into multiple sections, the notifications from that page will contain the entire page content and not only the small notification block of what changed.

h4. Expected results

Confluence should send small notification blocks nevertheless the page size or complexity.
fields.summary: Email notifications shows entire page instead of just modified changes

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

The following is occurring when using the Page Tree Macro:
* Clicking on "Collapse all" while the tree is Collapsed causes the links to disappears
* Clicking on "Expand all" while the tree is Expanded in Page tree macro causes the links to disappear
* If there are no child pages, both links are hidden.

The *finishLoadingMessage()* is not called and the status is not cleared, causing the links to be hidden.

Please see attached video.

h3. Steps to Reproduce

 # Insert Page Tree macro
 # Edit its properties and enable "Show Expand/Collapse Links">> save
 # Click on Expand All while the tree is expanded, or Collapse all while the tree is collapsed

or 

# Insert Page Tree macro
# Edit its properties and enable "Show Expand/Collapse Links">> save
# Add a page, but no child pages
# Click on Expand All or Collapse all

h3. Expected Results

The links shouldn't disappear and should work as expected if clicked while the tree already expanded or collapsed, or whether there are child pages are not.

h3. Actual Results

Links disappear or become text, see attached video

h3. Workaround

There is no workaround at this moment
fields.summary: Clicking on "Expand All" in Page Tree macro while tree is expanded causes the links to disappear

fields.description:

According to the documentation of Administering Collaborative Editing
https://confluence.atlassian.com/doc/administering-collaborative-editing-858772086.html

We should be able to change the page title but this is not the case.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
Try to change the page title under limited mode.

h3. Expected Results
We should be able to change the page title and save the page.

h3. Actual Results
It failed with an error: 
!Screen Shot 2019-12-19 at 10.30.10.png|thumbnail!

h3. Workaround
None

h3. Suggestion
As the page rename is a similar operation as moving the page. We should clarify in the documentation with the "Limited" Mode: 
* You can't change the page title.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

URLs with the format <base url>/display/~username are displaying the user profile page, instead of taking you to the personal space. 


h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Visit <base url>/display/~username  for a user in your site that has a personal space

h3. Expected Results

The personal space displays. 

h3. Actual Results

Displays the profile page for the user. 

 !image-2019-12-19-18-16-36-717.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround

To access a personal space, either append a page title to the end of the URL, e.g. <base url>/display/~username/home  or use the format <base url>/spaces/viewspace.action?key=~username
fields.summary: Personal space URL redirects to the user profile page

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

PDF export is failing when you include all child pages of the home page in an export. 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Export space to PDF > choose custom, and make sure the homepage and all child pages are selected.  Omit any pages at the root. 

h3. Expected Results

Space is exported with no problems. 

h3. Actual Results

Space export fails with the following error:

{panel}TOC should be replaced only with TOC of the same size. It is important because TOC size will affect TOC content (page offsets). This is a bit of chicken and egg problem, which makes us generate TOC twice.{panel}

 !image-2019-12-19-17-47-58-721.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround
Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: PDF Export of a space fails with TOC should be replaced error

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Repair the ancestors job compares CONFANCESTORS and CONTENT to check that its' broken, however its target is only "current" pages. Therefore the job doesn't repair if affected data is in draft.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a top level page.
# Create a draft of a page below the page created in step above
# You will see {{CONFANCESTORS}} table as below
{code:sql}
confluence=# select * from confancestors;
 descendentid | ancestorposition | ancestorid
--------------+------------------+------------
       327703 |                0 |     327683                   <-- Top level page
       327709 |                0 |     327683                   <-- Draft page 
       327709 |                1 |     327703                    <-- Draft page
{code}
# Break the data
{code:sql}
update confancestors set ancestorid=327683 where descendentid=327709;
{code}
You will see the sql result like this
{code:sql}
confluence=# select * from confancestors;
 descendentid | ancestorposition | ancestorid
--------------+------------------+------------
       327703 |                0 |     327683                   <-- Top level page
       327709 |                0 |     327683                   <-- Draft page 
       327709 |                1 |     327683                    <-- Draft page
{code}
# Run repair ancestors scheduled job.

h3. Expected Results
Repaired as below
{code:sql}
confluence=# select * from confancestors;
 descendentid | ancestorposition | ancestorid
--------------+------------------+------------
       327703 |                0 |     327683                   <-- Top level page
       327709 |                0 |     327683                   <-- Draft page 
       327709 |                1 |     327703                    <-- Draft page
{code}


h3. Actual Results
Not repaired.


h4. Note
The query to check if repair is needed introduced in [Rebuilding the Ancestor Table(6.13 or earlier)|https://confluence.atlassian.com/conf612/rebuilding-the-ancestor-table-958778330.html] returns draft data as well. So it should be included.
{code:sql}
SELECT A.ANCESTORID, A.DESCENDENTID, COUNT(A.DESCENDENTID)
FROM CONFANCESTORS A, CONTENT B
WHERE B.CONTENTID = A.DESCENDENTID
GROUP BY A.ANCESTORID, A.DESCENDENTID HAVING COUNT(A.DESCENDENTID) != 1
ORDER BY 3 DESC
{code}

h3. Workaround 1
# Find out the affected rows by following query.
{code:sql}
SELECT 'https://<base-url>/pages/viewpage.action?pageId=' || 
 A.DESCENDENTID
FROM CONFANCESTORS A, CONTENT B
WHERE B.CONTENTID = A.DESCENDENTID
GROUP BY A.ANCESTORID, A.DESCENDENTID HAVING COUNT(A.DESCENDENTID) != 1
{code}
# It will returns the affected draft pages, so open the url in the browser, and publish them all.
# Run repair the ancestors job

h3. Workaround 2
# Run the following query to determine page name, contentid and creator:
{code}
WITH draft_duplicates as (SELECT D.ANCESTORID, D.DESCENDENTID
FROM CONFANCESTORS D, CONTENT E
WHERE E.CONTENTID = D.DESCENDENTID
AND E.CONTENT_STATUS = 'draft'
GROUP BY D.ANCESTORID, D.DESCENDENTID HAVING COUNT(D.DESCENDENTID) != 1)

SELECT C.username, A.title, A.CONTENTID
FROM draft_duplicates as B
INNER JOIN CONTENT A ON B.DESCENDENTID = A.CONTENTID
INNER JOIN USER_MAPPING C ON A.creator = C.user_key;
{code}
# Have the creator delete the draft or publish it.
fields.summary: Repair the ancestors table job doesn't repair draft data

fields.description:
*Current behaviour*

Confluence will show a flag indicating that attachments on the page were updated. However, this only works for attachments that are "owned" by (directly attached to) the page. If the page is referencing an attachment from another page, and that attachment is updated, the notification flag doesn't show. 

*Expected behaviour*

The attachment update notification flag should when referenced attachments are updated.
fields.summary: Confluence "attachment updated" flag doesn't show for referenced attachments

fields.description:
*Current behaviour*

**This issue affects file edits from attachments that are referenced from another page. 

The "view" link in the new Companion file UI dialog links to the Confluence Preview for the file on the page where the file was originally attached. 

The page title in Companion is the title of the owner page. 

*Expected behaviour*

The "view" button always takes the user back to where they came from (i.e. where they previously clicked edit). 
 The page title shown in Companion is for the page that the user clicked edit from. 

 

!image-2020-04-08-15-02-09-703.png|width=401,height=158!
fields.summary: Companion page title and view button are for "owner" page

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

The [Confluence Source Editor|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/apps/1210722/confluence-source-editor] version 2.0.0 plugin when installed in Data Center is not available when an user is editing a template on *Space Tools > Content Tools > Create New Template*
h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Install the Confluence Source Editor version 2.0.0 in a Data Center environment (tested in versions 6.13.4 and 6.13.8)
# Go to *Space Tools > Content Tools > Create New Template*
# Notice there's no Source Editor tool available (expected when creating a new content)
 !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail! 
 !screenshot-5.png|thumbnail! 
# However, the page editor also *does not appear* if you edit an already existing template. If you try to edit the template, there'll be no page editor available.
 !screenshot-2.png|thumbnail! 
# The same behavior is *not* observable if you create a new page: when you're first creating a page, the page editor does not appear, which is expected:
 !screenshot-3.png|thumbnail! 
# But, when you edit the page, you have the page editor available:
 !screenshot-4.png|thumbnail!

h3. Expected Results
The page editor should show the <> icon in the top right indicating the source editor has loaded when editing the Space Template as well, same as when editing a page.

h3. Actual Results
The <> icon is missing upon loading the page editor when editing a Space Template.

h3. Workaround
Downgrade to the 1.1.3 version of the Confluence Source Editor plugin.
[Source Editor - version 1.1.3|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/download/apps/1210722/version/66]
fields.summary: Confluence Source Editor 2.0.0 add-on missing when editing a Template in a Space

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Comparing page versions with sections compares the entire page instead of just changes

This also affects email notifications that show the difference of what has changed in a page between versions
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a page with multiple sections
 # Add large amount of texts, a few pages worth
 # Edit the page somewhere in the middle
 # Compare the published version with the current one
 # Notice the entire page is displayed and does not truncate large chunks of unchaged text as expected into •••

h3. Expected Results

Large portions of unchanged text are hidden or truncated into ellipses •••
h3. Actual Results

The entire page is shown for comparison making it harder to find individual changes.
h4. Notes

Taken from our KB [page history & comparison|https://confluence.atlassian.com/doc/page-history-and-page-comparison-views-139379.html]:
{quote}When you view a page comparison, all large sections of unchanged text are hidden and reduced to an ellipsis (. . .).
{quote}
Which is true for pages without sections. If you use the same amount of text on a page with out sections, it will hide the large portions of text unchanged showing you only the modifications.
h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Comparing page versions or email diffs of pages with sections shows the entire page - not just changes

fields.description:

 It is necessary in some cases to highlight part of the preformatted text, for example to highlight certain part of code. currently page editor doesn't allow changing the colour of the preformatted text.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Removing page break before some macros causes the macro to be removed when inside of a panel.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create panel and add macro inside
# Delete in front of the macro in page editor (see attached *example.mov*)

h3. Expected Results
Page break is removed and the macro stays in the panel

h3. Actual Results
Macro and page break are removed

h3. Workaround
Use the macro outside of a panel



So far this has only been reproduced with Comala Canvas Board

fields.description:
h3. Information

Setting the size of the attached image to "Original" will allow the image to scale(resize) automatically to fit the screen browsing Confluence (eg: Browser) in the case if the browser size is smaller than the image.

Same goes to placing an image with the size set to "Original" _inside a table_ with *Fixed Width*, the image will scale(resize) according to the width of the table that is set by the editor.
h3. Problem Definition

However, placing an image with the size set to "Original" _inside a table_ with *Responsive* width will cause the _responsiveness_ of the table to scale up its border to the actual Original image size, ignoring the *browser size* and showing a horizontal scroll bar in the table, which can break the experience of displaying a large sized image in a Responsive table.

(i) The behavior described above can be seen in the videos below:
 * [^Original Image Size.mp4]
 * [^Image Scale vs Table Scale.mp4]
 ** Image that is used in the test: [^atlassian logo2.png]

h3. Suggested Solution

Allowing both the Table and Image to be _responsive_ to the *browser size* so everything can be shown in the screen without scrolling.
h3. Workaround

To ensure the table fits the browser size, you can add this custom CSS at either the site level (which will affect all pages in the instance) or the space level (which will affect only pages in that particular space).
{code:java}
table.confluenceTable td.confluenceTd img, table.confluenceTable td.confluenceTd .confluence-embedded-file-wrapper img, table.confluenceTable th.confluenceTh .confluence-embedded-file-wrapper img {
      max-width: inherit;
} {code}
*To edit a space's CSS style sheets:*
 # Go to the space and choose *Space tools* > *Look and Feel* from the bottom of the sidebar.
 # Choose *Stylesheet* then *Edit*.
 # Paste the custom CSS into the text field.
 # Save the changes.

*To edit the global CSS stylesheet:*
 # Choose  !https://confluence.atlassian.com/doc/files/747833194/747833195/2/1517274813281/cog.png|width=16!  > *General Configuration* > *Stylesheet*. 
 # Choose *Edit*.
 # Paste the custom CSS into the text field.
 # Choose *Save*.
fields.summary: Allow Image set to Original size that is placed in Responsive Table to fit in browser size

fields.description:
*Current behavior*
Currently, Team Calendar gadget cannot be viewed in Jira

*Step to reproduce:*
In Jira, "Add Gadget" --> "Confluence Page Gadget", addressing space a page and save. The result is the following error message:

{code}
Error rendering macro 'calendar' : No enum constant com.atlassian.confluence.content.render.xhtml.ConversionContextOutputType.PAGE_GADGET
{code}

and the following error message on the logs:
{code}
2012-10-26 12:52:48,875 ERROR [http-10432-1] [xhtml.view.macro.ViewMacroMarshaller] marshal Error rendering macro: calendar
 -- url: /rest/gadget/1.0/pagegadget/getrenderedpage.json | userName: admin
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException: No enum const class com.atlassian.confluence.content.render.xhtml.ConversionContextOutputType.PAGE_GADGET
{code}

*Reason that this is happening*
Team Calendars for Confluence macro is not currently compatible with the JIRA Page Gadget. This is explained here:
* [Cannot Display a Confluence page with a Team Calendars for Confluence macro in a JIRA Page Gadget|https://confluence.atlassian.com/confkb/cannot-display-a-confluence-page-with-a-team-calendars-for-confluence-macro-in-a-jira-page-gadget-308609791.html]
* [Make Team Calendars display in a Confluence Page Gadget, for use on a JIRA Dashboard|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-51407]

*Desired behavior:*
The error message is displaying something that's definitively an admin should not do, a human-readable error, such as
"Oops, Jira is not compatible with Team Calendars for Confluence gadget and therefore cannot display it"
fields.summary: Change error message that appears when attempting to add Team Calendar gadget into JIRA

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Select _Create Page_ from a Jira report results in _Create_ dialog in Confluence not rendering and just showing spinning loading graphic, when Confluence setup for anonymous access but no spaces have anonymous access.
h3. Steps to Reproduce

From confluence
 - enable _Anonymous Access_ from Global Permissions
 - under Space Permissions ensure no spaces have _anonymous access_ to viewing spaces and adding pages
 - Ensure user is not currently authenticated on Confluence server
 - Log in to Jira and attempt to create a page from a report that has the option (eg sprint report)

h3. Expected Results
 - The _Create_ dialog is populated with templates to create a page from

h3. Actual Results
 - The dialog doesn’t complete loading showing just a spinning _loading_ graphic

h3. Workaround
 - disable general anonymous access
 - enabling anonymous access to at least one space
 - pre-authenticate to confluence prior to attempting to create a page

 

*Notes*

HAR file shows the returned _promotedSpaces_ JSON text has an empty array for the _spaces_ list
{code:java}
{"promotedSpaces":
{"spaces":[],"resultsLimit":10,"resultsTruncated":false},"otherSpaces":{"spaces":[],"resultsLimit":1000,"resultsTruncated":false}}"
{code}
As opposed to a working system which would show like
{code:java}
{"promotedSpaces":
{"spaces":[],"resultsLimit":10,"resultsTruncated":false},"otherSpaces":{"spaces":[{"id":"ds","text":"Demonstration Space"}],"resultsLimit":1000,"resultsTruncated":false}}
{code}
This is what appears to stop the dialog from being populated with templates
fields.summary: 'Create' dialog in Confluence not showing template options but spinning load graphic when attempting to create page from Jira reports

fields.description:
As a user, the usage and result of synchronization can be confusing, and is not consistent with most other calendar apps.

The current integration works beautifully, but relies on humans to never err when selecting a calendar to sync with. 

A simple mistake may popolate TC with hundreds of unwanted events.

Worse, there is no API nor any other bulk update method for TC.

When important company calendars are impacted, especially those which already contained many events, they cannot simply be deleted and recreated. The only recourse may be manually deleting each event.

For all other calendar clients users are familiar with, removing the sync setup removes the events, however, this is NOT true with Team Calendars.

TC should drop events copied from external calendars when the synchronization is removed.
fields.summary: Removing Outlook or Google sync from a Team Calendar should remove events in TC

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
A certain amount of text within *Panel macro* will create blank pages upon PDF export before and after the macro

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a Test Confluence page
 # Insert a Panel macro
 # Add 29 or 30 new lines of text to macro
 (i) Number of lines is not a rule, there should be enough content to fit into a single page upon export to PDF, it can be paragraphs, lines, or just wall of text
You can use  [^30 lines in panel.txt] storage format as a test
 # Export page to PDF

h3. Expected Results
 * Upon export, you should get 1 or 2 pages depending on the amount of content on the page

h3. Actual Results
 * A blank page will appear before and/or after the panel macro upon export, different amount of lines/text creates a different effect
 ** 28 lines result in correct export
 ** 29 lines adds a blank page before panel macro
 ** 30 lines adds a blank page before and after panel macro
 ** 31 lines result in correct export

h3. Workaround
Adding the following to *PDF Stylesheet* results in correct page break within the *Panel macro*
{code:java}
.panel  
{  
border-color:#ffffff;  
page-break-before: never !important;  
page-break-inside: auto !important;  
page-break-after: never !important;  
}
{code}
fields.summary: Panel Macro with text creates blank pages in PDF Export

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

There was a man-in-the-middle (MITM) vulnerability present in the Confluence Previews plugin in Confluence Server and Confluence Data Center. This plugin was used to facilitate communication with the Atlassian Companion application. The Confluence Previews plugin in Confluence Server and Confluence Data Center communicated with the Companion application via the atlassian-domain-for-localhost-connections-only.com domain name, the DNS A record of which points at 127.0.0.1. Additionally, a signed certificate for the domain was publicly distributed with the Companion application. An attacker in the position to control DNS resolution of their victim could carry out a man-in-the-middle (MITM) attack between Confluence Server (or Confluence Data Center) and the atlassian-domain-for-localhost-connections-only.com domain intended to be used with the Companion application. This certificate has been revoked, however, usage of the atlassian-domain-for-localhost-connections-only.com domain name was still present in Confluence Server and Confluence Data Center. An attacker could perform the described attack by denying their victim access to certificate revocation information, and carry out a man-in-the-middle (MITM) attack to observe files being edited using the Companion application and/or modify them, and access some limited user information.

h3. Affected Versions
Versions of Confluence Server and Confluence Data Center affected by this vulnerability:
* from 6.11.0 before 6.13.10 (fixed in 6.13.10)
* from 6.14.0 before 6.15.10 (fixed in 6.15.10)
* from 7.0.1 before 7.0.5 (fixed in 7.0.5)
* from 7.1.0 before 7.1.2 (fixed in 7.1.2)

EAP and beta versions: 7.2.0-rc2, 7.2.0-rc1, 7.2.0-beta1, 7.1.0-rc3, 7.1.0-rc2, 7.1.0-rc1, 7.1.0-beta1, 7.0.1-rc1, 7.0.1-beta2, 7.0.1-beta1, 6.15.0-rc1, 6.15.0-beta2, 6.15.0-beta1, 6.14.0-rc1, 6.14.0-beta1, 6.13.0-rc1, 6.13.0-beta1, 6.12.0-rc1, 6.12.0-beta1, 6.11.0-rc1, 6.11.0-beta1

h3. Fixed Versions
h4. Confluence Server
Version 7.2.0 available at https://www.atlassian.com/software/confluence/download
Version 7.1.2 available at https://www.atlassian.com/software/confluence/download-archives
Version 7.0.5 available at https://www.atlassian.com/software/confluence/download-archives
Version 6.15.10 available at https://www.atlassian.com/software/confluence/download-archives
Version 6.13.10 available at https://www.atlassian.com/software/confluence/download-archives

h4. Confluence Data Center
Version 7.2.0 available at https://www.atlassian.com/software/confluence/download/data-center
Version 7.1.2 available at https://www.atlassian.com/software/confluence/download-archives
Version 7.0.5 available at https://www.atlassian.com/software/confluence/download-archives
Version 6.15.10 available at https://www.atlassian.com/software/confluence/download-archives
Version 6.13.10 available at https://www.atlassian.com/software/confluence/download-archives

h3. Notes
For additional details, see the full advisory: https://confluence.atlassian.com/doc/confluence-security-advisory-2019-12-18-982324349.html
fields.summary: Confluence Server and Data Center - Atlassian Companion Man-in-the-Middle - CVE-2019-15006

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

This ticket is used to track a bug on RDS - after Postgres 10 upgrade, Confluence may fail to start.

[https://dba.stackexchange.com/questions/237359/aws-rds-postgresql-master-user-lost-all-privileges-after-upgrading-from-v9-6]


 When ugprading to Postgres 10 on AWS RDS, Confluence can't find start, will errors 'bandana table does not exist'. 
 It's because after upgrade, public schema lost access privileges.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Connect to postgres sever (psql)
 # connect to confluence database by \c confluence
 # list out schemas \dn+

h3. Expected Results
 # rdsadmin user has access privileges

{code:java}
                          List of schemas
  Name  |  Owner   |  Access privileges   |      Description
--------+----------+----------------------+------------------------
 public | rdsadmin | rdsadmin=UC/rdsadmin+| standard public schema
        |          | =UC/rdsadmin         |
(1 row)
{code}
h3. Actual Results
 # access privileges are lost.
{code:java}
    List of schemas
  Name  |  Owner   | Access privileges |      Description
--------+----------+-------------------+------------------------
 public | rdsadmin |                   | standard public schema
(1 row)
{code}

h3. Workaround

Grant schema access to confluence user.
{code:java}
confluence=> ALTER SCHEMA public OWNER to atlconfluence;
ALTER SCHEMA
confluence=> GRANT ALL ON SCHEMA public TO atlconfluence;
GRANT
{code}
fields.summary: Upgrade to Postgres 10 on AWS RDS Confluence can't find tables

fields.description:
It would be a good idea to provide a single page showing a list of all spaces and their permissions on Confluence to the System administrators.

Especially on instances where there are a lot of spaces, it can be time-consuming to go through each space to check for anonymous, missing permissions or permissions that are no longer necessary.

A centralized page would help to check all spaces permissions at once.
h4. Workaround

As a workaround, you can use SQL queries to verify the spaces permissions:
 [How to Check Permissions for a Space via SQL Queries|https://confluence.atlassian.com/confkb/how-to-check-permissions-for-a-space-via-sql-queries-717062216.html]
{code:sql}
SELECT sp.permid, sp.permtype, s.spacekey, s.spacename, sp.permgroupname, um.lower_username
FROM SPACEPERMISSIONS sp
JOIN SPACES s ON sp.spaceid = s.spaceid
LEFT JOIN user_mapping um ON sp.permusername = um.user_key
WHERE s.spacekey = '<SPACEKEY>';
{code}
fields.summary: Provide a summary/report of all space permissions in the instance

fields.description:
Jira supports named user roles for projects, which helps simplify the process of assigning permissions to different users. With so many different permissions on Confluence spaces, it gets annoying having to copy the relevant permissions to each user or group based on how that user should use the space. Then, when the names are all sorted alphabetically, it's hard to tell who plays what role within the space: who are the "admins", who are the "editors", who are the "viewers", etc.

I would like to ask that a new named role feature be added to Confluence so that I can manually create roles for a given space, such as "Viewer" or "Editor", assign permissions to that role, then assign roles to users. It would also follow that the same roles for a space be available for restricted pages withing the space, effectively acting like a custom group available only within that space. This feature could exist alongside the existing permissions structure, in case people prefer the current approach.

A workaround is to create a global group within Confluence (or the upstream directory server(s)), e.g. "Custom Space XYZ Editors" and assign permissions to that group, but that requires admin input and pollutes the global group namespace. Instead, named roles within a space's permissions would not have either of these problems.
fields.summary: Add named user roles to space and page permissions

fields.description:
{panel:title=Note|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#6554c0|titleBGColor=#6554c0|bgColor=#eae6ff|titleColor=#ffffff}
*The fix has been backported and is pending release in Confluence 7.4.14.*

For more information about this and related content duplication issues, please see the discussion at [Confluence Server and Data Center: Content duplication fix and next steps \- Atlassian Community|https://community.atlassian.com/t5/Confluence-discussions/Confluence-Server-and-Data-Center-Content-duplication-fix-and/m-p/1873941#M9241].
{panel}
h3. Issue Summary
When editing a page, the page content, or a subset of the page content is duplicated. This behaviour occurs intermittently without any special actions by the user.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
This behaviour is not consistently reproducible, but may occur when a page is edited.

h3. Expected Results
The editor should display only the page content.

h3. Actual Results
The content appears to be duplicated in edit mode, and publishing the page results in the duplicated content being visible in view mode.

h3. Root Cause
*tl;dr* - Confluence and Synchrony metadata intermittently falls out of sync triggering a chain of events that result in content duplication.

When a user clicks the edit button, Synchrony will reconcile (merge) the page content held by Synchrony, with the draft content held in Confluence. This reconciled content is then sent to the web browser to be displayed in the editor, along with draft and synchrony metadata. When the editor loads, it synchronizes the new content back to Synchrony in a process called a {{client reconciliation}} to ensure everything is in sync.

The content duplication occurs during this client reconciliation phase. From the reports provided by customers and our internal reproduction work, we identified that the Synchrony metadata being provided contained a null value in place of the expected revision data. When Synchrony performed the client reconciliation, it performed the operation with an empty source document, thus all the content in the draft from the browser appeared new. Synchrony takes this "new" content, and adds it to the existing Confluence draft. This data is then sent back to the browser, where the user will see this duplicated content.

On the surface this may seem a nonsensical approach, but in the context of Synchrony, this approach works perfectly so long as the correct Synchrony metadata is provided. This explains how the content duplication occurs, but the root cause is earlier in the process when the page was last saved from Synchrony into the Confluence database.

Confluence takes advantage of an event system in the Hibernate Object Relation Manager. When a page is saved from Synchrony to Confluence, an event fires that synchronizes the metadata for Confluence and Synchrony, then cleans up stale Synchrony metadata. We identified that this event was intermittently and silently failing, resulting in the old metadata being left in Confluence, and then the matching metadata in Synchrony being deleted. Thus the when Synchrony performs the first reconciliation above, it does so with metadata from Confluence that doesn't exist in Synchrony, resulting in a null version being returned, and subsequently being served to the browser.

This issue was often automatically corrected by Confluence depending on a host of conditions that are outside of the scope of this explanation. This further obscured the root cause of the issue as it added a level of randomness to an already intermittent issue.

h3. Workaround
# In the Editor, click the Ellipsis ({{...}}) symbol
# Click {{Revert to last published version}}
fields.summary: Duplicate content shown when editing a page

fields.description:
h2. Issue Summary
One can attach a document to a Confluence page and select between displaying the attachment as a thumbnail or as a link. By default, a thumbnail is displayed and one would have to click on it then select *Show as link* to display a link instead of a thumbnail.

When attempting to do that on Microsoft Edge, the operation enters an endless loop and attempts to display the file instead of converting the thumbnail to a link. Therefore, one is unable to convert attachments from thumbnails to links using Edge.

h2. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a page.
# Attach any Office file to it.
# Save the page.
# At this point, the attachment should be displayed as a thumbnail.
!Screen Shot 2019-12-09 at 12.58.39.png|thumbnail!
# Edit the page.
# Click the thumbnail and click on *Show as link*.
!Screen Shot 2019-12-09 at 12.23.21.png|thumbnail!

h4. Expected Results
Thumbnail is converted to link as can be seen below and one is able to save the page changes:
!Screen Shot 2019-12-09 at 12.23.41.png|thumbnail!

h4. Actual Results
Edge actually opens the document contents and display them:
!image.png|thumbnail!

Once you close the preview you can save changes, but nothing really change as Edge is unable to convert the attachment to a link.

h2. Workaround
Not exactly a workaround, but use any other browser instead of Edge.
fields.summary: Show as link button doesn't work on Microsoft Edge

fields.description:
The European GDPR forces every platform provider of internet applications to provide proper privacy and imprint information individually on that platform.

We encountered that there is no easy way in Confluence to provide that Information.
 As you as software provider need to keep us as customer your might assist us keep Confluence running by providing at least a simple ability to set custom "privacy" and "imprint" links on every Confluence site (I think in that footer where also "about Confluence" and "Report a Problem" and so on is linked is a good place). We could create websites to present this information.

A better approach would be to have the gdpr/privacy/imprint information to be customizable in Confluence admin interface and simply klickable. But afaik this might be a bigger change.
fields.summary: Add customizable "privacy" and "imprint" Links in Footer

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Table of Contents macro is picking up the Headings in Blog Posts macro.
As the headings used by Blog Posts macro is not intended by the user, the end result for Table of Contents(ToC) is not showing the page structure correctly.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a new Space called SpaceA
# Create a new Page called PageOne
# In the newly created PageOne above, insert the macros below:
#* [Table of Contents macro|https://confluence.atlassian.com/doc/table-of-contents-macro-182682099.html]
#* [Blog Posts macro|https://confluence.atlassian.com/doc/blog-posts-macro-139470.html]
#** Set the {{Content Type to Display}} option to *titles*
# Publish PageOne
(!) Issue 1
# Create several Blogs in SpaceA
# Load PageA again
(!) Issue 2
# Edit PageOne in order to edit the Blog Posts macro
#* Set the {{Content Type to Display}} option to *entire*
(!) Issue 3

h3. Expected Results
h4. Issue 1 & 2 & 3
Table of Contents macro should not show any headings related to the Blog Posts macro

h3. Actual Results
h4. Issue 1
The "Blog stream" within the Blog Posts macro is shown in ToC macro section:
 !Issue 1.png|thumbnail! 

h4. Issue 2
The "Blog Posts" within the Blog Posts macro is shown in ToC macro section:
 !Issue 2.png|thumbnail! 

h4. Issue 3
Any heading that is used in the Blog will show in ToC macro section:
 !Issue 3.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround

For *Issue 2* and *Issue 3*, use the "entire" option in *Content Type to Display* instead.
 !Workaround 1.png|thumbnail! 
Currently there is no known workaround for *Issue 1*. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Table of Contents macro is picking up the Headings in Blog Posts macro

fields.description:
h3. Steps

*What happened...*

*What should have happened...*

In Confluence there is an option in the external directory connector options: "Update group memberships when logging in"

Examples from the screens to add Crowd or LDAP directories below:
 !crowd.png|thumbnail!

!ldap.png|thumbnail!

However [Connection to an LDAP Directory|https://confluence.atlassian.com/doc/connecting-to-an-ldap-directory-229838241.html] and [Connecting to Crowd or another JIRA application for user management|https://confluence.atlassian.com/doc/connecting-to-crowd-or-jira-for-user-management-229838465.html] do not appear to have documentation around this.

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Some documentation regarding external process pool needs to be updated for clarification.
 * [External Process Pool for Confluence Data Center|https://confluence.atlassian.com/doc/external-process-pool-for-confluence-data-center-958779098.html]
 This page doesn't refers to *page* *export* to PDF, which is also in scope of sandbox processing.
 * [Startup check: available memory|https://confluence.atlassian.com/confkb/startup-check-available-memory-951405871.html]
 This page introduces JVM parameter {{conversion.sandbox.disable}}, which won't work actually.

h3. Suggested Solution

The former page should be described as below.
{quote}The external process pool currently handles the following actions:
 * Document conversion (thumbnail generation for file previews)
 * *Exporting a page to PDF*
 * Exporting a space to PDF{quote}
The latter should be as below.
{quote}For Confluence 6.12 and later, set *pdf.export.sandbox.disable* and *document.conversion.sandbox.disable* system property to true and both document conversions and PDF export will be handled by Confluence.
{quote}
Note. [Recognized System Properties|https://confluence.atlassian.com/doc/recognized-system-properties-190430.html] introduces the above parameters and they work.

h3. Workaround

This is just a documentation fix. So no workaround needed.
fields.summary: Documentation regarding external process pool need to be updated

fields.description: I would like to have the same document exist in multiple spaces, and to have changes made in any location propagate to all locations. Thanks!
fields.summary: Allow linking of copied pages so that they stay in sync

fields.description:
At the moment, the 'All updates' Dashboard page provides a useful overview of recent changes to the wiki.

However, any large wiki tends to end up with:

1) Identical page names in multiple spaces and

2) Page names that are ambiguous unless you know which space they are in.

For example - a few that I can see right now: 'System tests', 'Incidents', 'Meetings'. This makes it hard to read the 'All updates' page and get a good understanding of what's changing (unless you happen to know which team the author works in). To improve this, I suggest *adding the space name alongside the title of the updated page*.

 

And hey, there's plenty of horizontal space!

!image-2019-12-05-14-30-56-800.png!

 

I believe this is the default page that users see when opening a Confluence wiki, so it has sense to make it good! However, the same issue can be seen on other, less-important pages - such as 'Popular', 'Recently worked on' and 'Recently visited'.
fields.summary: Show space names on the 'All updates' page

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Many pages in Confluence have a display issue when the contents don't fit in the width of the browser window (a horizontal scroll bar is added) since the white background does not extended to the page full width.

h3. Steps to Reproduce

 # Open the *Profile* page (via the profile picture);
 # Reduce the width of the browser windows until an horizontal scroll is displayed;
 # Open the *Space Directory* page;
 # Open the *Manage Apps* Admin page.

h3. Expected Results

All pages are displayed correctly, with the white background covering all the contents in the right areas.

h3. Actual Results

The page contents to the right don't have a white background, thus looking to be out of place.

 !Profile.png|thumbnail! 

 !SpaceDirectory.png|thumbnail! 

The *Manage Apps* page is correctly displayed as the white background extends to the full width of the contents.

 !ManageApps.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Notes

The issue has been observed in versions 6.13.x, 6.15.x and 7.1 of Confluence using Firefox and Chrome browsers.

It seems to affect most pages that have non-resizable content (tables, images, title) that is wider than the available width of the browser window, such as (in addition to the ones mentioned above):
* *Page History*
* The different pages in *Space tools*
* Any space page with wider content, in particularly tables

The pages in the *Administration* console, such as *Manage Apps* mentioned above, are correctly displayed, even the one containing wide tables.

h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Pages get incorrect background when browser window is narrow

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
If the text style inside the Info Macro is _Preformatted_, then the line wrapping shows correctly in the Edit mode but doesn’t work in the View/Published mode

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a page with an Info Macro
# Put a long piece of text inside the macro
# Format the Text as Preformatted
# Publish the Page

h3. Expected Results
The text should be wrapped within the macro in the View mode

h3. Actual Results
Text overrides the macro limit


h3. Workaround
Use any format other than Preformatted to render text correctly
fields.summary: Line wrapping doesn't work on Preformatted Text inside a Info Macro

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
* If there are disabled users/groups listed in a page's restrictions, the restrictions won't be applied as expected

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Add restrictions to a Confluence page
# Disable one of the users/groups added to the page's restrictions
# With an enabled user, try to access the page to view/edit it

h3. Expected Results
* The enabled user will be able to view/edit the restricted page, regardless of the other users/groups restrictions

h3. Actual Results
* The restrictions are inconsistent and not being applied correctly due to the disabled user/group

h3. Notes 
* The query below should return some details on the users/groups that are mentioned in the restrictions of the affected page, allowing users to identify if there are disabled users/groups in the restrictions of it:
{code:sql}
SELECT c.title,
       cps.content_id,
       cp.cp_type,
       um.username,
       cp.groupname,
       cwd.active
FROM CONTENT_PERM cp
JOIN CONTENT_PERM_SET cps ON cp.CPS_ID = cps.ID
JOIN USER_MAPPING um ON cp.username = um.user_key
JOIN CWD_USER cwd ON um.lower_username = cwd.lower_user_name
JOIN CONTENT c ON c.contentid = cps.content_id
WHERE c.title = 'NAME OF THE PAGE';
{code}

h3. Workaround
* Remove the disabled user/group of the page's restrictions
fields.summary: Restrictions don't work as expected when containing disabled users/groups

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

The text color option is missing the default text color, so the text color cannot be changed back to default once it has been changed.

The default text color has been changed from black to dark blue(#172b4d) on the recent version, but the default color does not exist on the color option. So, if the text color has been changed, there is no way to go back to the default color.
 !color-option.png|thumbnail! 
h3. Environment

All the environment.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Install Confluence 6.14.3 or higher
 # Check the default text color is dark blue(#172b4d)
 # Confirm the color option does not have the same color.

h3. Expected Results

The text color option should have the default color. So, the text can be changed back to the default color.
h3. Actual Results

The default text color does not exist on the color option.
h2. *Workaround*

The text color can be changed back to default if the same color selected again. For example, if the text color has been changed to *Black*. To revert back to the default color, the same *Black* color can be selected again.
fields.summary: Need default text colour "#172b4d" on the color option in the page editor

fields.description:
As a Jira power user, I need to ability to show/hide custom field IDs when choosing fields to add to columns, as well as in the column headings, so that I can differentiate between fields of the same name.

We are a large enterprise with several thousand fields, many of which have the same name (even though they're different field types). We need the ability to differentiate easily by custom field ID (and by field type if possible) when trying to select fields to include as columns in the Issue List view. Additionally we would like the ability to display the field IDs next or under the field names in the header row, e.g.: Field (ID). Each user should have the show/hide option for this.
fields.summary: Ability to show/hide custom field IDs to field names

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When creating a blog post or page, before saving it, you may want to attach and insert a multimedia file (not an image file). After uploading the file, and trying to insert the multimedia macro, the uploaded file won't show up on the file list, and can't be included on the page, until the blog is posted.

Subsequent editing (after the blog post or page is first submitted) allows the multimedia macro to find the uploaded file with no other changes.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Make sure Collaborative Editing is *enabled*
 # Create a new Blog Post or Page
 # Upload a multimedia file (such as a .mp4 video file)
 # Insert the Multimedia Macro

h3. Expected Results

The newly uploaded file would be available on the Multimedia Macro file list, and can be inserted on the page
h3. Actual Results

The file list on the Multimedia Macro will be empty
h3. Notes

This error only occurs with Collaborative Editing enabled.

It also affect the [View File macros|https://confluence.atlassian.com/doc/view-file-macro-170494360.html]; if you replace the type of file and the macro in the steps to reproduce above, you get the same result.
h3. Workaround

There are two possible workarounds to be able to insert multimedia files successfully, on blog posts:
 * Save the Blog Post or Page first. After editing the blog post or page, the uploaded multimedia files will show up on the macro's file list.
 * [Disable Collaborative Editing|https://confluence.atlassian.com/doc/administering-collaborative-editing-858772086.html#AdministeringCollaborativeEditing-Changetheeditingmode], as this issue does not occur when it's turned off
fields.summary: Attachments can't be inserted when creating blog post or page, using the Multimedia macro

h3. Steps to Reproduce

h3. Expected Results

h3. Actual Results
The pages are displaying as the screenshots below.
*Confluence 6.13.9*
 !image-2019-12-03-21-10-51-453.png|thumbnail!

*Confluence 7.0.1*

fields.description:
{panel:title=Atlassian Update - Feb 2020} Hi All, We have prepared a fix for this issue and we have made this fix available in the Confluence EAP release 7.4.0-m05 and in Confluence 7.3.3.  We went through all cases reported for this issue (at least all we were able to reproduce), and fixed it by introducing a new recovery mechanism for unreconciled page updates. Recovery should happen transparently for all callers, so the API should behave as it used to before 7.0 (but now without danger of losing unpublished changes). Please give it a try and provide feedback. On a side note please keep in mind, that in rare cases ExternalChangesException can still happen in the case where content update fails for some reason, so please don't forget to handle it appropriately. The fix also includes changes to solve the problem with visibility of ExternalChangesException class in the plugins and changes to the confusing exception message. Lastly, if you need more fine access over the content reconciliation process, please consider using PageUpdateService. Its prepare() method can be used to ensure that content and draft are synchronized and are ready for updates. Methods of this service can be called within as well as outside of the active database transaction. Thank you for your patience and we look forward to receiving your feedback on this fix. Regards,  The Confluence Team {panel} h3. Issue Summary Updating a page via REST API causes 501 error after upgrading to Confluence 7+ the first time it's called. The propertyname = 'sync-rev-source' or equivalent from the table *contentproperties* is replaced with the value *restored* in all rows. Viewing the page or making the call again will succeed as it sets the '*propertyname*' back to '*synchrony*' or '*synchrony-ack*' as expected. h3. Steps to Reproduce # Install Confluence 6.15.9 and make sure the Demonstration Space was created (You can create other pages for testing) # Run the following query: {code:java} select * from contentproperties where propertyname = 'sync-rev-source';{code} # ## Make sure that none of the properties is set to 'restored'. They should be either 'synchrony-ack' or 'synchrony' as described on [How do drafts work|https://confluence.atlassian.com/confkb/how-do-drafts-work-on-confluence-938043306.html]. # Upgrade Confluence to 7.1.0 # Make sure not to view any of the pages # Execute the same query again. You should be able to see that every property was set to 'restored': {code:java} +--------------+-----------------+---------------+-----------+-----------+-------------+ | propertyid | propertyname | stringval | longval | dateval | contentid | |--------------+-----------------+---------------+-----------+-----------+-------------| | 131237 | sync-rev-source | restored | | | 65590 | | 131328 | sync-rev-source | restored | | | 65628 | | 131291 | sync-rev-source | restored | | | 65607 | {code} # Pick one of the rows with 'restored' value and it's contentId and execute following REST {code:java} PUT request: {base-url} /rest/api/content/ {contentId} with this json body: {"id":{contentId} ,"type":"page", "title":"new page updated","space": {"key":"key"} ,"body":{"storage":{"value": "

This is the updated text for the new page updated

","representation":"storage"}},"version": {"number":1} }} {code} # Notice the following response: {code:java} { "statusCode": 501, "message": "Unable to save changes to unreconciled page ContentId {id=65607} . Refreshing the page should fix this.", "reason": "Not Implemented" }{code} h3. Expected Results The page is updated accordingly. h3. Actual Results A 501 error is received and the page is not updated. h3. Workaround Making the call again or viewing the page will allow it to work as it sets the _stringval_ in *contentproperties* back to synchrony or synchrony-ack. * 7.0.2 - Disabling/enabling collaborative editing clears the 'sync-rev-source' values and allows the calls to work. This method *does not* work for 7.1.0. h4. Notes Known to cause issues with some plugins like K15 *Scroll Versions* when trying to publish pages, as the same error is thrown when using the JAVA API methods {{saveContentEntity()}} and {{saveNewVersion()}} from the {{com.atlassian.confluence.pages.DefaultPageManager}} class. Calling again the methods *does not* *always* work in setting the _stringval_ in *contentproperties* back from "restored" as opposed to the REST API so that workaround for plugins is not reliable.
fields.summary: Updating a page via REST API causes 501 error after upgrading to Confluence 7+ due to contentproperties table modification

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Syncs between Confluence & Crowd (with delegated LDAP directory) can cause longer than expected sync times due to a large number of groups. This is due to difference in the DAO models between Crowd and Confluence and the volume of groups as required by the sync. 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Integrate Confluence and Crowd
# Set up a Confluence application in Crowd
# Create a directory and add a delegated connection to AD with ~ 40k groups. Associate this directory with the Confluence application in Crowd
# Sync the directory from Confluence

h3. Expected Results
# Sync times will remain relatively low and will not take longer over time.

h3. Actual Results
# Sync times gradually increase over time as groups are added to the data set.

h3. Workaround
Confluence doesn't come with indexes on the lower_group_name, but adding one can certainly improve processing speed:

For Postgres:
{code}
CREATE INDEX idx_lower_group_name ON public.cwd_group USING btree (lower_group_name);
{code}
fields.summary: Confluence + Crowd Syncs is not performant when a large number of groups is synced

fields.description:
As a space administrator I want to add a group to the manage watchers list to have less administration for watchers.

 

A standard use case is for a team to want to be notified on changes to a page.

Adding or removing members form the group makes more sense than adding and removing individuals from the watch list for all pages owned by the team.
fields.summary: Add a group in the manage watchers list

fields.description:

It would be good to have seamless copy-paste functionality between Confluence and Word.

fields.description:
The "Insert numbering column" feature is very useful – and I personally use it daily.

Working very much like "Insert numbering column", the "Insert checkbox column" button would simply add a column containing a single checkbox to each row in the table.  

This would allow a long list of rows to instantly be transformed into a task list!
fields.summary: Insert checkbox column (modeled after "Insert numbering column")

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

User password update is not logged in the audit log.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Navigate to Confluence administrator > *Users* from the sidebar.
 # Click on a <user name> and select *Set Password*.
 # Change password and *save*.
 # Navigate sidebar and click on *Audit log*

h3. Expected Results

The password update should be logged. 
 According the Atlassian status: User & Group Management is a part of the audit trail. CONFSERVER-6960
h3. Actual Results

The password change is not logged in Audit log. 
h3. Workaround

Possibly, admin can utilize Auditor plugin. [Auditor for Confluence|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/apps/1214138/auditor-for-confluence?hosting=server&tab=overview] 
 Or
 Enable user access logging. [How to Enable User Access Logging|https://confluence.atlassian.com/confkb/how-to-enable-user-access-logging-182943.html]
fields.summary: Changing password for User in Confluence administration is not logged in Audit log

fields.description:
The Confluence [Usage Statistics Macro|https://ecosystem.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/USGTRK/overview] can only display the events 'view', 'create', and 'update', but it has no option to display the actual count of existing pages or blogs.

Although mentioned in the documentation, the event 'remove' also doesn't return consistent results.

The [Site Statistics|https://confluence.atlassian.com/doc/viewing-site-statistics-123043962.html] and [Space Activity|https://confluence.atlassian.com/doc/view-space-activity-2818381.html] pages show only 'Viewing' and 'Editing' events.

This is a request to enhance the Confluence Statistics functionality by adding the count of existing pages/blogs in the *Usage Statistics Macro* and in the *Global Activity* and *Space Activity* pages - and fixing the documentation regarding the functionalities available.
fields.summary: Usage Statistics improvement

fields.description:
Searching for answers on questions using keywords in the search bar. The results shown in the drop-down do not include the topics. The latter must be searched under topics. It would be convenient if the search bar offered "text" and "topic" matches.

!image-2019-11-27-11-45-04-559.png!
fields.summary: Search on Q&A does not include topics

fields.description:
Automatic user synchronization (when a synchronization interval is set) stops working when manual synchronization is run.

*Steps to Reproduce*
# Create a User Directory in Confluence (e.g. with a JIRA server or AD)
# Define a Synchronisation Interval (e.g. 5 minutes)
# Check it is running fine.
# Click *Synchronize* on the directory listing.
# Wait for the Synchronisation Interval again. It won't run.

*Workaround*

To have it working again, it is necessary to Edit the User Directory and set the Synchronisation Interval again.

Issue happening with version 7.0.1.
fields.summary: Automatic user synchronization stops if manual synchronization is performed

fields.description:
h3. Description

When Confluence base URL is set to HTTPS, the Roadmap Planner Macro content breaks when exported as PDF or Office file

h3. Steps to reproduce
# Create a page and insert the Roadmap Planner Macro. Generate content for it.
# Have SSL configured for Confluence at Connector level
# Set the base URL to https://confluence-url.fqdn:port-if-needed
# Go to the page that created in step 1
# Export the page as PDF or Word

h3. Expected result
Page content fully export with correct content from Roadmap Planner Macro.

h3. Actual result
Page export is broken, not showing image content from the macro.

h3. Workaround
Set the URL to http://localhost:8090/your-context

Additional Info: Customer originally affected by this bug uses Scroll Office Plugin from K15t GmbH to customize the office templates as per their company standards, since default Confluence export content from pages may not have customized formats. They used this plugin during their tests. Is it possible to test any results with this plugin as well? Thank you.
fields.summary: When Confluence base URL is set to HTTPS, the Roadmap Planner Macro content breaks when exported as PDF or Office file

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

The Page Properties Report macro does not sort correctly when using the "Sort by" display option on a column that contains dates that are added via a user macro, as opposed to using date picket.
h3. Environment

In order for the test to be accurate, you need an existing Confluence instance with pages already created in different dates
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a user macro named "CreateDate" with the following code:
{code:none}
 ## @noparams
 #set( $createD = $content.getCreationDate())<time Datetime="$action.dateFormatter.formatGivenString("yyyy-MM-dd", $createD)"/>{code}

 # On the older page, add a Page Properties macro with the following table:
|*Description*|<enter some text>|
|*Created*|<insert the macro "CreateDate">|

 # On the newer page add a Page Properties macro as in the previous step;
 # Add the label "testdate" to the 2 pages;
 # Create a new page and add the Page Properties Report macro configured with the "testdate" label and the *Sort by* display option set to "Created".

h3. Expected Results

The table should be sorted by the "Created" column.
h3. Actual Results

The table is sorted by last modified date, as default.
h3. Workaround

Currently there is no other workaround for this behavior except for entering date via the Date Picker macro. Clicking on the column with the dates will sort the table correctly as only the initial sorting is affected by this issue.
fields.summary: Page Properties Report macro "Sort by" for date values does not work when date is added via a user macro

fields.description:
We need to provide Knowledge Base articles to Service Desk customers and restrict which pages they can see.

This is because we support multiple product lines and the documentation for each is confidential - each documentation set can only be seen by specific groups of customers.

There appears to be no way to restrict the Confluence pages to certain groups (without giving each user a license).

One of the reasons we chose Service Desk for customer support was because of the ability to create a KB so a bit disappointing that we can't use it.

Same requirement as for CONFCLOUD-64798
fields.summary: Customer-specific Confluence pages linked to Service Desk

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

According to our documentation, wiki markup should be converted upon import of Word file. Excerpt from documentation:
{quote}
h2. Notes

If your document contains characters that are the same as [Confluence wiki markup|https://confluence.atlassian.com/doc/confluence-wiki-markup-251003035.html] (for example square brackets, hashes etc) these characters may be automatically converted to their wiki markup value when you import your document, or wrapped in a wiki markup macro to preserve the formatting. 
{quote}
Currently, macros are not converted when a word file is imported.

Link to documentation:

 [Import a Word Document into Confluence|https://confluence.atlassian.com/doc/import-a-word-document-into-confluence-170493136.html]

 
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a word file
 # Insert dummy content
 # Insert wiki markup to define a macro
 # Import the word file into Confluence

h3. Expected Results

The wiki markup is converted and macros are rendered in the Confluence page
h3. Actual Results

No macro is displayed and markup is displayed as normal text.

!image-2019-11-25-15-59-51-889.png|width=504,height=130!
h3. Suggested resolution

Change the documentation to actually reflect what is expected or implement the feature as described within documentation
h3.  
h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Importing a Word file with macros as markup does not convert the markup to macros

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Searching for text in *.xlsx* files is not returning the *.xlsx* file as a result.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create an .xlsx document in Excel. Include unique text within the body. Attach to a page in Confluence.
 # Create a second Excel document, with another set of unique text. Save as .xls file instead. Attach this to a page in Confluence as well.
 # Ensure Confluence is reindexed.
 # Attempt to search for the 1st document with the unique text that was in the body. Searching for the 2nd document will return that document. Note that searching text in the title will still work. This issue is with text in the body.

h3. Expected Results

Searching for text within an .xlsx file should return that attachment as a result, along with a preview of the text.
h3. Actual Results

According to [Search|https://confluence.atlassian.com/doc/search-139528.html]:
{quote}When you enter a search term, Confluence looks for content in all spaces (including personal spaces), pages, mail, personal profiles, and space descriptions. It also looks at the content of some attached file types (Word, Text, PowerPoint, Excel, PDF, and HTML).
{quote}
However, searching for text in .xlsx files is not returning any results. When the document comes up in search results, it also does not preview any text from the document, only any comments in Confluence associated with the attachment.

When searching text in .*xls* file, it previews the first few lines of the spreadsheet.

(i) Confirmed that search of text in .doc, .docx, and .xls _does_ return results.
h3. Workaround

Save the spreadsheet as an *.xls* file.
fields.summary: Unable to return search results for .xlsx files

fields.description:
h2. Suggestion Summary
Confluence should provide administrators with a way to toggle displaying version related information on/off.

h2. Suggestion Details
If unauthenticated, one can access Confluence's landing page and retrieve version related information from three places:

* Login page footer.
* Response Head AJS Tags.
* Response Body What's New Link.

Someone without good intentions could use this information to search for possible security vulnerabilities over the internet and hack Confluence. Therefore, if in a public facing instance, hiding these pieces of information can become a requirement for administrators.

h2. Workaround
An administrator can modify Confluence core files to prevent this information from being displayed. The knowledge base below teaches how to do that:
* [How to Hide Version Information on Confluence|https://confluence.atlassian.com/confkb/how-to-hide-version-information-on-confluence-980460833.html]
fields.summary: Ability to Toggle Version Information on Confluence Pages On/Off

fields.description:
Currently, when installing Confluence using Docker, it will start a new installation from scratch, which is not desirable in cases on which the end goal is to move an existing installation (or clone a Confluence instance, to create a test instance).

It would be useful to provide an option to start the Docker container with an already finished installation (with all of the settings already present on the existing {{confluence.cfg.xml}} file), as it would simplify this process.
fields.summary: Improve docker container behavior when moving/copying a Confluence instance

Next, we would like to then select application name from the drop down list that we will be having all the application names from JIRA instance. And then to show that selected data in the data sheet created.

Could you kindly suggest us of a way to get this requirement done.
fields.summary: Is there any way of getting all the application list from the JIRA Instance in Confluence Instance?
